ci_support_linux_64_python3.10.____cpyth:
c_compiler:
- gcc
c_compiler_version:
- '14'
c_stdlib:
- sysroot
c_stdlib_version:
- '2.17'
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  python:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
python:
- 3.10.* *_cpython
rust_compiler:
- rust
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.description:
textual-speedups provides optional Rust implementations of performance-critical
classes used by Textual. Currently includes Rust implementations of geometry
classes (Offset, Size, Region, Spacing) that are heavily used in layout updates.
Install alongside Textual and set TEXTUAL_SPEEDUPS=1 to enable.
about.summary: Rust speedups for Textual terminal UI framework

name: textual-speedups

about.description:
textual-speedups provides optional Rust implementations of performance-critical
classes used by Textual. Currently includes Rust implementations of geometry
classes (Offset, Size, Region, Spacing) that are heavily used in layout updates.
Install alongside Textual and set TEXTUAL_SPEEDUPS=1 to enable.
about.summary: Rust speedups for Textual terminal UI framework

about.description:
textual-speedups provides optional Rust implementations of performance-critical
classes used by Textual. Currently includes Rust implementations of geometry
classes (Offset, Size, Region, Spacing) that are heavily used in layout updates.
Install alongside Textual and set TEXTUAL_SPEEDUPS=1 to enable.
about.summary: Rust speedups for Textual terminal UI framework

raw_meta_yaml:
# yaml-language-server: $schema=https://raw.githubusercontent.com/prefix-dev/recipe-format/main/schema.json
schema_version: 1

# Note: This is a Rust-Python hybrid package using maturin/pyo3
# License assumed MIT (same as main Textual project by same author)

context:
  name: textual-speedups
  version: "0.2.1"

package:
  name: ${{ name }}
  version: ${{ version }}

source:
  url: https://pypi.org/packages/source/t/textual-speedups/textual_speedups-${{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 72cf0f7bdeede015367b59b70bcf724ba2c3080a8641ebc5eb94b36ad1536824

build:
  number: 2
  script:
    - cargo-bundle-licenses --format yaml --output THIRDPARTY.yml
    - ${{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . -vv --no-deps --no-build-isolation

requirements:
  build:
    - ${{ compiler("c") }}
    - ${{ stdlib("c") }}
    - ${{ compiler("rust") }}
    - cargo-bundle-licenses
    - if: build_platform != target_platform
      then:
        - python
        - cross-python_${{ target_platform }}
        - maturin >=1.8,<2.0
  host:
    - python
    - pip
    - maturin >=1.8,<2.0
  run:
    - python

tests:
  - python:
      imports:
        - textual_speedups
      pip_check: true

about:
  summary: Rust speedups for Textual terminal UI framework
  description: |
    textual-speedups provides optional Rust implementations of performance-critical
    classes used by Textual. Currently includes Rust implementations of geometry
    classes (Offset, Size, Region, Spacing) that are heavily used in layout updates.
    Install alongside Textual and set TEXTUAL_SPEEDUPS=1 to enable.
  homepage: https://github.com/willmcgugan/textual-speedups
  repository: https://github.com/willmcgugan/textual-speedups
  license: MIT
  license_file:
    - LICENSE
    - THIRDPARTY.yml

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - rxm7706

about.description:
textual-speedups provides optional Rust implementations of performance-critical
classes used by Textual. Currently includes Rust implementations of geometry
classes (Offset, Size, Region, Spacing) that are heavily used in layout updates.
Install alongside Textual and set TEXTUAL_SPEEDUPS=1 to enable.
about.summary: Rust speedups for Textual terminal UI framework
